text: This is a record of the life of Jesus the Messiah, the son of David, the son of Abraham.
speaker: Narrator

text: Abraham fathered Isaac, Isaac fathered Jacob, and Jacob fathered Judah and his brothers.
speaker: Narrator

text: Judah fathered Perez and Zerah by Tamar, Perez fathered Hezron, Hezron fathered Aram,
speaker: Narrator

text: Aram fathered Amminadab, Amminadab fathered Nahshon, and Nahshon fathered Salmon.
speaker: Narrator

text: Salmon fathered Boaz by Rahab, Boaz fathered Obed by Ruth, Obed fathered Jesse,
speaker: Narrator

text:
and Jesse fathered King David.
David fathered Solomon by the wife of Uriah,
speaker: Narrator

text: Solomon fathered Rehoboam, Rehoboam fathered Abijah, Abijah fathered Asaph,
speaker: Narrator

text: Asaph fathered Jehoshaphat, Jehoshaphat fathered Joram, Joram fathered Uzziah,
speaker: Narrator

text: Uzziah fathered Jotham, Jotham fathered Ahaz, Ahaz fathered Hezekiah,
speaker: Narrator

text: Hezekiah fathered Manasseh, Manasseh fathered Amos, and Amos fathered Josiah.
speaker: Narrator

text: Josiah fathered Jechoniah and his brothers at the time of the deportation to Babylon.
speaker: Narrator

text: After the deportation to Babylon, Jechoniah fathered Salathiel, Salathiel fathered Zerubbabel,
speaker: Narrator

text: Zerubbabel fathered Abiud, Abiud fathered Eliakim, Eliakim fathered Azor,
speaker: Narrator

text: Azor fathered Zadok, Zadok fathered Achim, Achim fathered Eliud,
speaker: Narrator

text: Eliud fathered Eleazar, Eleazar fathered Matthan, and Matthan fathered Jacob.
speaker: Narrator

text: Jacob fathered Joseph, the husband of Mary, who was the mother of Jesus, who is called the Messiah.
speaker: Narrator

text: So all the generations from Abraham to David totaled fourteen generations, and from David to the deportation to Babylon totaled fourteen generations, and from the deportation to Babylon to the Messiah there were fourteen generations.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now the birth of Jesus the Messiah happened in this way. When his mother Mary was engaged to Joseph, before they lived together she was discovered to be pregnant by the Holy Spirit.
speaker: Narrator

text: Her husband Joseph, being a righteous man and unwilling to disgrace her, decided to divorce her secretly.
speaker: Narrator

text: After he had thought about it, an angel of the Lord appeared to him in a dream. “Joseph, son of David,” he said, “don’t be afraid to take Mary as your wife, because what has been conceived in her is from the Holy Spirit.
speaker: Narrator

text: She will give birth to a son, and you are to name him Jesus, because he is the one who will save his people from their sins.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Now all this happened to fulfill what was declared by the Lord through the prophet when he said,
speaker: Narrator

text:
“See, a virgin will become pregnant
    and give birth to a son,
        and they will name him Immanuel,”
which means, “God with us.”
speaker: Narrator

text: When Joseph got up from his sleep, he did as the angel of the Lord had commanded him and took Mary as his wife.
speaker: Narrator

text: He did not have marital relations with her until she had given birth to a son; and he named him Jesus.
speaker: Narrator

text: After Jesus had been born in Bethlehem of Judea during the reign of King Herod, wise men arrived in Jerusalem from the east
speaker: Narrator

text: and asked, “Where is the one who was born king of the Jews? We saw his star in the east and have come to worship him.”
speaker: Narrator

text: When King Herod heard this, he was disturbed, as was all of Jerusalem.
speaker: Narrator

text: He called together all the high priests and scribes of the people and asked them where the Messiah was to be born.
speaker: Narrator

text: They told him, “In Bethlehem of Judea, because that is what was written by the prophet:
speaker: Narrator

text:
‘O Bethlehem in the land of Judah,
    you are by no means least among the rulers of Judah,
because from you will come a ruler
    who will shepherd my people Israel.’”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Herod secretly called together the wise men, found out from them the time the star had appeared,
speaker: Narrator

text: and sent them to Bethlehem. He told them, “As you go, search carefully for the child. When you find him, tell me so that I, too, may go and worship him.”
speaker: Narrator

text: After listening to the king, they set out, and the star they had seen in the east went ahead of them until it came and stopped over the place where the child was.
speaker: Narrator

text: When they saw the star, they were ecstatic with joy.
speaker: Narrator

text: After they went into the house and saw the child with his mother Mary, they fell down and worshipped him. Then they opened their treasure sacks and offered him gifts of gold, frankincense, and myrrh.
speaker: Narrator

text: Having been warned in a dream not to go back to Herod, they left for their own country by a different road.
speaker: Narrator

text: After they had gone, an angel of the Lord appeared to Joseph in a dream. “Get up, take the child and his mother, and flee to Egypt,” he said. “Stay there until I tell you, because Herod intends to search for the child and kill him.”
speaker: Narrator

text: So Joseph got up, took the child and his mother, and left at night for Egypt.
speaker: Narrator

text: He stayed there until Herod’s death in order to fulfill what was declared by the Lord through the prophet when he said, “Out of Egypt I called my Son.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Herod flew into a rage when he learned that he had been tricked by the wise men, so he ordered the execution of all the male children in Bethlehem and all its neighboring regions, who were two years old and younger, according to the time that he had determined from the wise men.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then what was declared by the prophet Jeremiah was fulfilled when he said,
speaker: Narrator

text:
“A voice was heard in Ramah:
    wailing and great mourning.
Rachel was crying for her children.
    She refused to be comforted,
        because they no longer existed.”
speaker: Narrator

text: But after Herod died, an angel of the Lord appeared in a dream to Joseph in Egypt.
speaker: Narrator

text: “Get up,” he said. “Take the child and his mother, and go to the land of Israel, because those who were trying to kill the child are dead.”
speaker: Narrator

text: So Joseph got up, took the child and his mother, and went into the land of Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text: But when he heard that Archelaus was ruling over Judea in place of his father Herod, he was afraid to go there, after having been warned in a dream. So he left for the region of Galilee
speaker: Narrator

text: and settled in a town called Nazareth in order to fulfill what was said by the prophets: “He will be called a Nazarene.”
speaker: Narrator

text: About this time, John the Baptist appeared, preaching in the Judean wilderness,
speaker: Narrator

text: “Repent, because the kingdom from heaven is near!”
speaker: Narrator

text:
He was the one the prophet Isaiah was referring to when he said,
“He is a voice calling out in the wilderness:
    ‘Prepare the way for the Lord!
        Make his paths straight!’”
speaker: Narrator

text: John had clothing made of camel’s hair and wore a leather belt around his waist. His diet consisted of grasshoppers and wild honey.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the people of Jerusalem, all Judea, and the entire region along the Jordan began flocking to him,
speaker: Narrator

text: being baptized by him in the Jordan River while they confessed their sins.
speaker: Narrator

text: But when John saw many Pharisees and Sadducees coming to where he was baptizing, he told them, “You children of serpents! Who warned you to flee from the coming wrath?
speaker: Narrator

text: Produce fruit that is consistent with repentance!
speaker: Narrator

text: Don’t think you can say to yourselves, ‘We have father Abraham!’ because I tell you that God can raise up descendants for Abraham from these stones!
speaker: Narrator

text: The ax already lies against the roots of the trees. So every tree that isn’t producing good fruit will be cut down and thrown into the fire.
speaker: Narrator

text: I am baptizing you with water as evidence of repentance, but the one who is coming after me is stronger than I am, and I am not worthy to carry his sandals. It is he who will baptize you with the Holy Spirit and fire.
speaker: Narrator

text: His winnowing fork is in his hand. He will clean up his threshing floor and gather his grain into the barn, but he will burn the chaff with inextinguishable fire.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Jesus came from Galilee to the Jordan to be baptized by John.
speaker: Narrator

text: But John tried to stop him, saying, “I need to be baptized by you, and are you coming to me?”
speaker: Narrator

text:
But Jesus answered him, “Let it be this way for now, because this is the proper way for us to fulfill all righteousness.”
At this, he permitted him to be baptized.
speaker: Jesus

text: When Jesus had been baptized, he immediately came up out of the water. Suddenly, the heavens opened up for him, and he saw the Spirit of God descending like a dove and coming to rest on him.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then a voice from heaven said, “This is my Son, whom I love. I am pleased with him!”
speaker: Narrator

text: After this, Jesus was led by the Spirit into the wilderness to be tempted by the Devil.
speaker: Narrator

text: After fasting for 40 days and 40 nights, he finally became hungry.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the tempter came. “Since you are the Son of God,” he said, “tell these stones to become loaves of bread.”
speaker: Narrator

text:
But he answered, “It is written,
‘One must not live on bread alone,
    but on every word coming
        out of the mouth of God.’”
speaker: Jesus

text: Then the Devil took him to the Holy City and had him stand on the highest point of the Temple.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He told Jesus, “Since you are the Son of God, throw yourself down, because it is written,
‘God will put his angels in charge of you,’
and,
‘With their hands they will hold you up,
    so that you will never hit your foot against a rock.’”
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus responded to him, “It is also written, ‘You must not tempt the Lord your God.’”
speaker: Jesus

text: Once more the Devil took him to a very high mountain and showed him all the kingdoms of the world, along with their splendor.
speaker: Narrator

text: He told Jesus, “I will give you all these things if you will bow down and worship me!”
speaker: Narrator

text:
Then Jesus told him, “Go away, Satan! Because it is written,
‘You must worship the Lord your God
    and serve only him.’”
speaker: Jesus

text: So the Devil left him, and angels came and began ministering to him.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now when Jesus heard that John had been arrested, he went back to Galilee.
speaker: Narrator

text: He left Nazareth and settled in Capernaum by the sea, in the regions of Zebulun and Naphtali,
speaker: Narrator

text: in order to fulfill what was declared by the prophet Isaiah when he said,
speaker: Narrator

text:
“O Land of Zebulun and Land of Naphtali,
    on the road to the sea, across the Jordan,
        Galilee of the unbelievers!
speaker: Narrator

text:
The people living in darkness have seen a great light,
    and for those living in the land and shadow of death,
        a light has risen.”
speaker: Narrator

text: From then on, Jesus began to announce, “Repent, because the kingdom from heaven is near!”
speaker: Narrator

text: While Jesus was walking beside the Sea of Galilee, he saw two brothers—Simon (also called Peter) and his brother Andrew. They were casting a net into the sea, because they were fishermen.
speaker: Narrator

text: “Follow me,” he told them, “and I will make you fishers of people!”
speaker: Narrator

text: So at once they left their nets and followed him.
speaker: Narrator

text: Going on from there he saw two other brothers—James, son of Zebedee, and his brother John. They were in a boat with their father Zebedee repairing their nets. When he called them,
speaker: Narrator

text: they immediately left the boat and their father and followed him.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then he went throughout Galilee, teaching in their synagogues, proclaiming the gospel of the kingdom, and healing every disease and every illness among the people.
speaker: Narrator

text: His fame spread throughout Syria, and people brought to him everyone who was sick—those afflicted with various diseases and pains, the demon-possessed, the epileptics, and the paralyzed—and he healed them.
speaker: Narrator

text: Large crowds from Galilee, the Decapolis, Jerusalem, Judea, and from across the Jordan followed him.
speaker: Narrator

text: When Jesus saw the crowds, he went up on the hill. After taking his seat, his disciples came to him,
speaker: Narrator

text: and he began to teach them:
speaker: Narrator

text:
“How blessed are those who are destitute in spirit,
    because the kingdom from heaven belongs to them!
speaker: Jesus

text:
“How blessed are those who mourn,
    because it is they who will be comforted!
speaker: Jesus

text:
“How blessed are those who are humble,
    because it is they who will inherit the earth!
speaker: Jesus

text:
“How blessed are those who are hungry and thirsty for righteousness,
    because it is they who will be satisfied!
speaker: Jesus

text:
“How blessed are those who are merciful,
    because it is they who will receive mercy!
speaker: Jesus

text:
“How blessed are those who are pure in heart,
    because it is they who will see God!
speaker: Jesus

text:
“How blessed are those who make peace,
    because it is they who will be called God’s children!
speaker: Jesus

text:
“How blessed are those who are persecuted for righteousness’ sake,
    because the kingdom from heaven belongs to them!
speaker: Jesus

text: “How blessed are you whenever people insult you, persecute you, and say all sorts of evil things against you falsely because of me!
speaker: Jesus

text: Rejoice and be extremely glad, because your reward in heaven is great! That’s how they persecuted the prophets who came before you.”
speaker: Jesus

text: “You are the salt of the world. But if the salt should lose its taste, how can it be made salty again? It’s good for nothing but to be thrown out and trampled on by people.
speaker: Jesus

text: “You are the light of the world. A city located on a hill can’t be hidden.
speaker: Jesus

text: People don’t light a lamp and put it under a basket but on a lamp stand, and it gives light to everyone in the house.
speaker: Jesus

text: In the same way, let your light shine before people in such a way that they will see your good actions and glorify your Father in heaven.”
speaker: Jesus

text: “Do not think that I came to destroy the Law or the Prophets. I didn’t come to destroy them, but to fulfill them,
speaker: Jesus

text: because I tell all of you with certainty that until heaven and earth disappear, not one letter or one stroke of a letter will disappear from the Law until everything has been accomplished.
speaker: Jesus

text: So whoever sets aside one of the least of these commandments and teaches others to do the same will be called least in the kingdom from heaven. But whoever does them and teaches them will be called great in the kingdom from heaven
speaker: Jesus

text: because I tell you, unless your righteousness greatly exceeds that of the scribes and Pharisees, you will never enter the kingdom from heaven!”
speaker: Jesus

text: “You have heard that it was told those who lived long ago, ‘You are not to commit murder,’ and, ‘Whoever murders will be subject to punishment.’
speaker: Jesus

text: But I say to you, anyone who is angry with his brother without a cause will be subject to punishment. And whoever says to his brother ‘Raka!’ will be subject to the Council. And whoever says, ‘You fool!’ will be subject to hell fire.
speaker: Jesus

text: “So if you are presenting your gift at the altar and remember there that your brother has something against you,
speaker: Jesus

text: leave your gift there before the altar and first go and be reconciled to your brother. Then come and offer your gift.
speaker: Jesus

text: Come to terms quickly with your opponent while you are on the way to court, or your opponent may hand you over to the judge, and the judge to the guard, and you will be thrown into prison.
speaker: Jesus

text: I tell you with certainty, you will not get out of there until you pay back the last dollar!”
speaker: Jesus

text: “You have heard that it was said, ‘You are not to commit adultery.’
speaker: Jesus

text: But I say to you, anyone who stares at a woman with lust for her has already committed adultery with her in his heart.
speaker: Jesus

text: So if your right eye causes you to sin, tear it out and throw it away. It is better for you to lose one of your body parts than to have your whole body thrown into hell.
speaker: Jesus

text: And if your right hand causes you to sin, cut it off and throw it away from you. It is better for you to lose one of your body parts than to have your whole body go into hell.”
speaker: Jesus

text: “It was also said, ‘Whoever divorces his wife must give her a written notice of divorce.’
speaker: Jesus

text: But I say to you, any man who divorces his wife, except for sexual immorality, causes her to commit adultery, and whoever marries a divorced woman commits adultery.”
speaker: Jesus

text: “Again, you have heard that it was told those who lived long ago, ‘You must not swear an oath falsely,’ but, ‘You must fulfill your oaths to the Lord.’
speaker: Jesus

text: But I tell you not to swear at all, neither by heaven, because it is God’s throne,
speaker: Jesus

text: nor by the earth, because it is his footstool, nor by Jerusalem, because it is the city of the Great King.
speaker: Jesus

text: Nor should you swear by your head, because you cannot make one hair white or black.
speaker: Jesus

text: Instead, let your message be ‘Yes’ for ‘Yes’ and ‘No’ for ‘No.’ Anything more than that comes from the evil one.”
speaker: Jesus

text: “You have heard that it was said, ‘An eye for an eye and a tooth for a tooth.’
speaker: Jesus

text: But I tell you not to resist an evildoer. On the contrary, whoever slaps you on the right cheek, turn the other to him as well.
speaker: Jesus

text: If anyone wants to sue you and take your shirt, let him have your coat as well.
speaker: Jesus

text: And if anyone forces you to go one mile, go two with him.
speaker: Jesus

text: Give to the person who asks you for something, and do not turn away from the person who wants to borrow something from you.”
speaker: Jesus

text: “You have heard that it was said, ‘You must love your neighbor’ and hate your enemy.
speaker: Jesus

text: But I say to you, love your enemies, and pray for those who persecute you,
speaker: Jesus

text: so that you will become children of your Father in heaven, because he makes his sun rise on both evil and good people, and he lets rain fall on the righteous and the unrighteous.
speaker: Jesus

text: If you love those who love you, what reward will you have? Even the tax collectors do the same, don’t they?
speaker: Jesus

text: And if you greet only your relatives, that’s no great thing you’re doing, is it? Even the unbelievers do the same, don’t they?
speaker: Jesus

text: So be perfect, as your heavenly Father is perfect.”
speaker: Jesus

text: “Be careful not to practice your righteousness in front of people in order to be noticed by them. If you do, you will have no reward from your Father in heaven.
speaker: Jesus

text: So whenever you give to the poor, don’t blow a trumpet before you like the hypocrites do in the synagogues and in the streets so that they will be praised by people. I tell all of you with certainty, they have their full reward!
speaker: Jesus

text: But when you give to the poor, don’t let your left hand know what your right hand is doing,
speaker: Jesus

text: so that your giving may be done in secret. And your Father who sees in secret will reward you.”
speaker: Jesus

text: “And whenever you pray, don’t be like the hypocrites who love to stand in the synagogues and on the street corners so that they will be seen by people. I tell all of you with certainty, they have their full reward!
speaker: Jesus

text: But whenever you pray, go into your room, close the door, and pray to your Father who is hidden. And your Father who sees from the hidden place will reward you.
speaker: Jesus

text: “When you are praying, don’t say meaningless things like the unbelievers do, because they think they will be heard by being so wordy.
speaker: Jesus

text: Don’t be like them, because your Father knows what you need before you ask him.
speaker: Jesus

text:
Therefore, this is how you should pray:
‘Our Father in heaven,
    may your name be kept holy.
speaker: Jesus

text:
May your kingdom come.
    May your will be done,
        on earth as it is in heaven.
speaker: Jesus

text: Give us today our daily bread,
speaker: Jesus

text:
and forgive us our sins,
    as we have forgiven those who have sinned against us.
speaker: Jesus

text:
And never bring us into temptation,
    but deliver us from the evil one.’
speaker: Jesus

text: Because if you forgive people their offenses, your heavenly Father will also forgive you.
speaker: Jesus

text: But if you do not forgive people their offenses, your Father will not forgive your offenses.”
speaker: Jesus

text: “Whenever you fast, don’t be gloomy like the hypocrites, because they put on sad faces to show others they are fasting. I tell all of you with certainty, they have their full reward!
speaker: Jesus

text: But when you fast, put oil on your head and wash your face,
speaker: Jesus

text: so that your fasting will not be noticed by others but by your Father who is in the hidden place. And your Father who watches from the hidden place will reward you.”
speaker: Jesus

text: “Stop storing up treasures for yourselves on earth, where moths and rust destroy and where thieves break in and steal.
speaker: Jesus

text: But keep on storing up treasures for yourselves in heaven, where moths and rust do not destroy and where thieves do not break in and steal,
speaker: Jesus

text: because where your treasure is, there your heart will be also.”
speaker: Jesus

text: “The eye is the lamp of the body. So if your eye is healthy, your whole body will be full of light.
speaker: Jesus

text: But if your eye is evil, your whole body will be full of darkness. Therefore, if the light within you has turned into darkness, how great is that darkness!”
speaker: Jesus

text: “No one can serve two masters, because either he will hate one and love the other, or be loyal to one and despise the other. You cannot serve God and riches!”
speaker: Jesus

text: “That’s why I’m telling you to stop worrying about your life—what you will eat or what you will drink—or about your body—what you will wear. Life is more than food, isn’t it, and the body more than clothing?
speaker: Jesus

text: Look at the birds in the sky. They don’t plant or harvest or gather food into barns, and yet your heavenly Father feeds them. You are more valuable than they are, aren’t you?
speaker: Jesus

text: Can any of you add a single hour to the length of your life by worrying?
speaker: Jesus

text: And why do you worry about clothes? Consider the lilies in the field and how they grow. They don’t work or spin yarn,
speaker: Jesus

text: but I tell you that not even Solomon in all of his splendor was clothed like one of them.
speaker: Jesus

text: Now if that is the way God clothes the grass in the field, which is alive today and thrown into an oven tomorrow, won’t he clothe you much better—you who have little faith?
speaker: Jesus

text: “So don’t ever worry by saying, ‘What are we going to eat?’ or ‘What are we going to drink?’ or ‘What are we going to wear?’
speaker: Jesus

text: because it is the unbelievers who are eager for all those things. Surely your heavenly Father knows that you need all of them!
speaker: Jesus

text: But first be concerned about God’s kingdom and his righteousness, and all of these things will be provided for you as well.
speaker: Jesus

text: So never worry about tomorrow, because tomorrow will worry about itself. Each day has enough trouble of its own.”
speaker: Jesus

text: “Stop judging, so that you won’t be judged,
speaker: Jesus

text: because the way that you judge others will be the way that you will be judged, and you will be evaluated by the standard with which you evaluate others.
speaker: Jesus

text: “Why do you see the speck in your brother’s eye but fail to notice the beam in your own eye?
speaker: Jesus

text: Or how can you say to your brother, ‘Let me take the speck out of your eye,’ when the beam is in your own eye?
speaker: Jesus

text: You hypocrite! First remove the beam from your own eye, and then you will see clearly enough to remove the speck from your brother’s eye.”
speaker: Jesus

text: “Never give what is holy to dogs or throw your pearls before pigs. Otherwise, they will trample them with their feet and then turn around and attack you.”
speaker: Jesus

text: “Keep asking, and it will be given to you. Keep searching, and you will find. Keep knocking, and the door will be opened for you.
speaker: Jesus

text: Because everyone who keeps asking will receive, and the person who keeps searching will find, and the person who keeps knocking will have the door opened.
speaker: Jesus

text: “There isn’t a person among you who would give his son a stone if he asked for bread, is there?
speaker: Jesus

text: Or if he asks for a fish, he wouldn’t give him a snake, would he?
speaker: Jesus

text: So if you who are evil know how to give good gifts to your children, how much more will your Father in heaven give good things to those who keep on asking him!
speaker: Jesus

text: Therefore, whatever you want people to do for you, do the same for them, because this summarizes the Law and the Prophets.”
speaker: Jesus

text: “Go in through the narrow gate, because the gate is wide and the road is spacious that leads to destruction, and many people are entering by it.
speaker: Jesus

text: How narrow is the gate and how constricted is the road that leads to life, and there aren’t many people who find it!”
speaker: Jesus

text: “Beware of false prophets who come to you in sheep’s clothing but inwardly are savage wolves.
speaker: Jesus

text: You will know them by their fruit. Grapes aren’t gathered from thorns, or figs from thistles, are they?
speaker: Jesus

text: In the same way, every good tree produces good fruit, but a rotten tree produces bad fruit.
speaker: Jesus

text: A good tree cannot produce bad fruit, and a rotten tree cannot produce good fruit.
speaker: Jesus

text: Every tree that doesn’t produce good fruit will be cut down and thrown into a fire.
speaker: Jesus

text: So by their fruit you will know them.”
speaker: Jesus

text: “Not everyone who keeps saying to me, ‘Lord, Lord,’ will get into the kingdom from heaven, but only the person who keeps doing the will of my Father in heaven.
speaker: Jesus

text: Many will say to me on that day, ‘Lord, Lord, we prophesied in your name, drove out demons in your name, and performed many miracles in your name, didn’t we?’
speaker: Jesus

text: Then I will tell them plainly, ‘I never knew you. Get away from me, you who practice evil!’”
speaker: Jesus

text: “Therefore, everyone who listens to these messages of mine and puts them into practice is like a wise man who built his house on a rock.
speaker: Jesus

text: The rain fell, the floods came, and the winds blew and beat against that house, but it did not collapse because its foundation was on the rock.
speaker: Jesus

text: “Everyone who keeps on hearing these messages of mine and never puts them into practice is like a foolish man who built his house on sand.
speaker: Jesus

text: The rain fell, the floods came, the winds blew and battered that house, and it collapsed—and its collapse was total.”
speaker: Jesus

text: When Jesus had finished saying all these things, the crowds were utterly amazed at his teaching,
speaker: Narrator

text: because he was teaching them like a person who had authority, and not like their scribes.
speaker: Narrator

text: When Jesus came down from the hillside, large crowds followed him.
speaker: Narrator

text: Suddenly, a leper came up to him, fell down before him, and said, “Sir, if you want to, you can make me clean.”
speaker: Narrator

text: So Jesus reached out his hand, touched him, and said, “I do want to. Be clean!” And instantly his leprosy was made clean.
speaker: Jesus

text: Then Jesus told him, “See to it that you don’t speak to anyone. Instead, go and show yourself to the priest, and then offer the sacrifice that Moses commanded as proof to the authorities.”
speaker: Jesus

text: When Jesus returned to Capernaum, a centurion came up to him and begged him repeatedly,
speaker: Narrator

text: “Sir, my servant is lying at home paralyzed and in terrible pain.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus told him, “I will come and heal him.”
speaker: Jesus

text: The centurion replied, “Sir, I am not worthy to have you come under my roof. But just say the word, and my servant will be healed,
speaker: Narrator

text: because I, too, am a man under authority and I have soldiers under me. I say to one of them ‘Go’ and he goes, to another ‘Come’ and he comes, and to my servant ‘Do this’ and he does it.”
speaker: Narrator

text: When Jesus heard this, he was amazed and told those who were following him, “I tell all of you with certainty, not even in Israel have I found this kind of faith!
speaker: Jesus

text: I tell all of you, many will come from east and west and will feast with Abraham, Isaac, and Jacob in the kingdom from heaven.
speaker: Jesus

text: But the unfaithful heirs of that kingdom will be thrown into the darkness outside. In that place there will be wailing and gnashing of teeth.”
speaker: Jesus

text: “Go,” Jesus told the centurion, “and it will be done for you, just as you have believed.” And his servant was healed that very hour.
speaker: Jesus

text: When Jesus went into Peter’s house, he saw Peter’s mother-in-law lying in bed, sick with a fever.
speaker: Narrator

text: He touched her hand, and the fever left her. Then she got up and began serving him.
speaker: Narrator

text: When evening came, people brought to him many who were possessed by demons. He drove out the spirits by speaking a command and healed everyone who was sick.
speaker: Narrator

text:
This was to fulfill what was declared by the prophet Isaiah when he said,
“It was he who took our illnesses away
    and removed our diseases.”
speaker: Narrator

text: When Jesus saw the large crowds around him, he gave orders to cross to the other side of the Sea of Galilee.
speaker: Narrator

text: Just then, a scribe came up and told him, “Teacher, I will follow you wherever you go.”
speaker: Narrator

text:
Jesus told him,
“Foxes have holes and birds have nests,
    but the Son of Man has no place to rest.”
speaker: Jesus

text: Then another of his disciples told him, “Lord, first let me go and bury my father.”
speaker: Narrator

text: But Jesus told him, “Follow me, and let the dead bury their own dead.”
speaker: Jesus

text: When Jesus got into the boat, his disciples went with him.
speaker: Narrator

text: Suddenly, a violent storm came up on the sea, so that the boat began to be swamped by the waves. Yet Jesus kept sleeping.
speaker: Narrator

text: They went to him and woke him up. “Lord!” they cried, “Save us! We’re going to die!”
speaker: Narrator

text: He asked them, “Why are you afraid, you who have little faith?” Then he got up and rebuked the winds and the sea, and there was a great calm.
speaker: Jesus

text: The men were amazed. “What kind of man is this?” they asked. “Even the winds and the sea obey him!”
speaker: Narrator

text: When Jesus arrived on the other side in the region of the Gerasenes, two demon-possessed men met him as they were coming out of the tombs. They were so violent that no one could travel on that road.
speaker: Narrator

text: Suddenly, they screamed, “What do you want with us, Son of God? Did you come here to torture us before the proper time?”
speaker: Narrator

text: Now a large herd of pigs was grazing some distance away from them.
speaker: Narrator

text: So the demons began to plead with Jesus, saying, “If you drive us out, send us into that herd of pigs.”
speaker: Narrator

text: He told them, “Go,” and they came out and went into the pigs. Suddenly, the whole herd rushed down a steep slope into the sea and drowned in the water.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now when those who had been taking care of the pigs ran away, they came into the city and reported everything, especially what had happened to the demon-possessed men.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the whole city went out to meet Jesus, and as soon as they saw him, they begged him to leave their region.
speaker: Narrator

text: After getting into a boat, Jesus crossed to the other side and came to his own city.
speaker: Narrator

text: All at once some people brought him a paralyzed man lying on a stretcher. When Jesus saw their faith, he told the paralyzed man, “Be courageous, son! Your sins are forgiven.”
speaker: Jesus

text: Then some of the scribes told themselves, “This fellow is blaspheming!”
speaker: Narrator

text: But Jesus, knowing what they were thinking, replied, “Why do you have such evil thoughts in your hearts?
speaker: Jesus

text: Which is easier: to say, ‘Your sins are forgiven,’ or to say, ‘Get up and walk’?
speaker: Jesus

text: But so you will know that the Son of Man has authority on earth to forgive sins…” he told the paralyzed man, “Get up, pick up your stretcher, and go home!”
speaker: Jesus

text: So the man got up and went home.
speaker: Narrator

text: When the crowds saw this, they became frightened and glorified God for giving such authority to humans.
speaker: Narrator

text: As Jesus went on from there, he saw a man named Matthew sitting at the tax collector’s desk and told him, “Follow me.” So he got up and followed him.
speaker: Jesus

text: While he was having dinner at Matthew’s home, many tax collectors and sinners arrived and began eating with Jesus and his disciples.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Pharisees saw this and asked his disciples, “Why does your teacher eat with tax collectors and sinners?”
speaker: Narrator

text: When Jesus heard that, he said, “Healthy people don’t need a physician, but sick people do.
speaker: Jesus

text: Go and learn what this means: ‘I want mercy and not sacrifice,’ because I did not come to call righteous people, but sinners.”
speaker: Jesus

text: Then John’s disciples came to Jesus and asked, “Why do we and the Pharisees fast often, but your disciples don’t fast?”
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus asked them, “The wedding guests can’t mourn as long as the groom is with them, can they? But the time will come when the groom will be taken away from them, and then they will fast.”
speaker: Jesus

text: “No one patches an old garment with a piece of unshrunk cloth, because the patch pulls away from the garment, and a worse tear results.
speaker: Narrator

text: Nor do people pour new wine into old wineskins. If they do, the skins will burst, the wine will spill out, and the skins will be ruined. Instead, they pour new wine into fresh wineskins, and both are preserved.”
speaker: Jesus

text: While Jesus was telling them these things, an official came up and fell down before him. “My daughter has just died,” he said. “But come and lay your hand on her, and she will live.”
speaker: Narrator

text: So Jesus got up and followed him, along with his disciples.
speaker: Narrator

text: Just then a woman who had been suffering from chronic bleeding for twelve years came up behind him and touched the tassel of his garment,
speaker: Narrator

text: because she had been saying to herself, “If I just touch his robe, I will get well.”
speaker: Narrator

text: When Jesus turned and saw her, he said, “Be courageous, daughter! Your faith has made you well.” And from that very hour the woman was well.
speaker: Jesus

text: When Jesus came to the official’s house and saw the flute players and the crowd making a commotion,
speaker: Narrator

text: he said, “Go away! The young lady hasn’t died, but is sleeping.” But they ridiculed him with laughter.
speaker: Narrator

text: When the crowd had been driven outside, he went in, took her by the hand, and the young lady got up.
speaker: Narrator

text: The news of this spread throughout that land.
speaker: Narrator

text: As Jesus was traveling on from there, two blind men followed him, shouting, “Have mercy on us, Son of David!”
speaker: Narrator

text:
When he had gone into the house, the blind men came to him.
Jesus asked them, “Do you believe I can do this?”
They told him, “Yes, Lord!”
speaker: Jesus

text: Then he touched their eyes and said, “According to your faith, let it be done for you!”
speaker: Jesus

text: And their eyes were opened. Then Jesus sternly told them, “See to it that nobody knows about this.”
speaker: Jesus

text: But they went out and spread the news about him throughout that region.
speaker: Narrator

text: As the men were going out, a man who couldn’t talk because he was demon-possessed was brought to him.
speaker: Narrator

text: As soon as the demon had been driven out, the man began to speak. The crowds were amazed and said, “Nothing like this has ever been seen in Israel!”
speaker: Narrator

text: But the Pharisees kept saying, “He drives out demons by the ruler of demons.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Jesus began traveling throughout all the cities and villages, teaching in their synagogues, proclaiming the gospel of the kingdom, and healing every disease and every illness.
speaker: Narrator

text: When he saw the crowds, he was deeply moved with compassion for them, because they were troubled and helpless, like sheep without a shepherd.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then he told his disciples, “The harvest is vast, but the workers are few.
speaker: Jesus

text: So ask the Lord of the harvest to send out workers into his harvest.”
speaker: Jesus

text: Then Jesus called his twelve disciples to him and gave them authority over unclean spirits, so that they could drive them out and heal every disease and every illness.
speaker: Narrator

text: These are the names of the twelve apostles: first, Simon (who is called Peter) and his brother Andrew; James, the son of Zebedee, and his brother John;
speaker: Narrator

text: Philip and Bartholomew; Thomas and Matthew the tax collector; James, the son of Alphaeus, and Thaddaeus;
speaker: Narrator

text: Simon the Cananaean and Judas Iscariot, who later betrayed Jesus.
speaker: Narrator

text: These were the Twelve whom Jesus sent out after he had given them these instructions: “Don’t turn on to the road that leads to the unbelievers, and don’t enter Samaritan towns.
speaker: Jesus

text: Instead, go to the lost sheep of the nation of Israel.
speaker: Jesus

text: As you go, make this announcement: ‘The kingdom from heaven is near!’
speaker: Jesus

text:
Heal the sick, raise the dead, cleanse lepers, drive out demons.
You have received without payment,
    so give without payment.
speaker: Jesus

text: Don’t take any gold, silver, or copper in your moneybags,
speaker: Jesus

text: or a traveling bag for the trip, or an extra shirt, or sandals, or a walking stick, because a worker deserves his food.
speaker: Jesus

text: “Whatever town or village you enter, find out who is receptive in it and stay there until you leave.
speaker: Jesus

text: As you enter the house, greet its occupants.
speaker: Jesus

text: If the household is receptive, let your blessing of peace come on it. But if it isn’t receptive, let your blessing of peace return to you.
speaker: Jesus

text: If no one welcomes you or listens to your words, as you leave that house or town, shake its dust off your feet.
speaker: Jesus

text: I tell all of you with certainty, it will be more bearable for the region of Sodom and Gomorrah on the day of judgment than for that town!”
speaker: Jesus

text: “Pay attention, now! I am sending you out like sheep among wolves. So be as cunning as serpents and as innocent as doves.
speaker: Jesus

text: Watch out for people who will hand you over to the local councils and whip you in their synagogues.
speaker: Jesus

text: You will be brought before governors and kings because of me, to testify to them and to unbelievers.
speaker: Jesus

text: When they hand you over, don’t worry about how you are to speak or what you are to say, because in that hour what you are to say will be given to you.
speaker: Jesus

text: It won’t be you speaking, but the Spirit of your Father speaking through you.
speaker: Jesus

text: “Brother will hand brother over for execution, and a father his child. Children will rebel against parents and have them put to death.
speaker: Jesus

text: You will be hated by everyone because of my name. But the person who endures to the end will be saved.
speaker: Jesus

text: So when they persecute you in one town, flee to the next, because I tell all of you with certainty that you will not have gone through the towns of Israel before the Son of Man comes.
speaker: Jesus

text: “A disciple is not above his teacher, and a slave is not above his master.
speaker: Jesus

text: It is enough for a disciple to be like his teacher and a slave to be like his master. If they have called the head of the house Beelzebul, how much more will they do the same to those of his household!”
speaker: Jesus

text: “So never be afraid of them, because there is nothing hidden that will not be revealed, and nothing secret that will not be made known.
speaker: Jesus

text: What I tell you in darkness you must speak in the daylight, and what is whispered in your ear you must shout from the housetops.
speaker: Jesus

text: Stop being afraid of those who kill the body but can’t kill the soul. Instead, be afraid of the one who can destroy both body and soul in hell.
speaker: Jesus

text: “Two sparrows are sold for a penny, aren’t they? Yet not one of them will fall to the ground without your Father’s permission.
speaker: Jesus

text: Indeed, even the hairs on your head have all been counted!
speaker: Jesus

text: So stop being afraid. You are worth more than a bunch of sparrows.”
speaker: Jesus

text: “Therefore, everyone who acknowledges me before people I, too, will acknowledge before my Father in heaven.
speaker: Jesus

text: But whoever denies me before people I, too, will deny before my Father in heaven.”
speaker: Jesus

text: “Do not think that I came to bring peace on earth. I did not come to bring peace but a sword!
speaker: Jesus

text:
I came to turn
‘a man against his father,
    a daughter against her mother,
    and a daughter-in-law against her mother-in-law.
speaker: Jesus

text: A person’s enemies will include members of his own family.’
speaker: Jesus

text: “The one who loves his father or mother more than me isn’t worthy of me, and the one who loves a son or daughter more than me isn’t worthy of me.
speaker: Jesus

text: The one who doesn’t take up his cross and follow me isn’t worthy of me.
speaker: Jesus

text: The one who finds his life will lose it, and the one who loses his life because of me will find it.”
speaker: Jesus

text: “The one who receives you receives me, and the one who receives me receives the one who sent me.
speaker: Jesus

text: The one who receives a prophet as a prophet will receive a prophet’s reward, and the one who receives a righteous person as a righteous person will receive a righteous person’s reward.
speaker: Jesus

text: I tell all of you with certainty, whoever gives even a cup of cold water to one of these little ones because he is a disciple will never lose his reward.”
speaker: Jesus

text: When Jesus had finished instructing his twelve disciples, he left there to teach and preach in their home towns.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now when John heard in prison about the activities of the Messiah, he sent a message by his disciples
speaker: Narrator

text: and asked him, “Are you the Coming One, or should we wait for someone else?”
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus answered them, “Go and tell John what you hear and observe:
speaker: Narrator

text: the blind see, the lame walk, lepers are cleansed, the deaf hear, the dead are raised, and the destitute hear the good news.
speaker: Narrator

text: How blessed is anyone who is not offended by me!”
speaker: Narrator

text: As they were leaving, Jesus began to speak to the crowds about John. “What did you go out into the wilderness to see? A reed shaken by the wind?
speaker: Narrator

text: Really, what did you go out to see? A man dressed in fancy clothes? See, those who wear fancy clothes live in kings’ houses.
speaker: Narrator

text: Really, what did you go out to see? A prophet? Yes, I tell you, and even more than a prophet!
speaker: Narrator

text:
This is the man about whom it is written,
‘See, I am sending my messenger ahead of you,
    who will prepare your way before you.’
speaker: Narrator

text: I tell all of you with certainty, among those born of women no one has appeared who is greater than John the Baptist. Yet even the least important person in the kingdom from heaven is greater than he.
speaker: Narrator

text: “From the days of John the Baptist until the present, the kingdom from heaven has been forcefully advancing, and violent people have been attacking it,
speaker: Narrator

text: because the Law and all the Prophets prophesied up to the time of John.
speaker: Narrator

text: If you are willing to accept it, he is Elijah who is to come.
speaker: Narrator

text: Let the person who has ears listen!
speaker: Narrator

text: “To what can I compare the people living today? They’re like little children who sit in the marketplaces and shout to each other,
speaker: Narrator

text:
‘A wedding song we played for you,
    the dance you all did scorn.
A woeful dirge we chanted, too,
    but then you would not mourn.’
speaker: Narrator

text: Because John didn’t come eating or drinking, yet people say, ‘He has a demon!’
speaker: Narrator

text:
The Son of Man came eating and drinking, and they say, ‘Look, a glutton and a drunk, a friend of tax collectors and sinners!’
Absolved from every act of sin,
    is wisdom by her kith and kin.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Jesus began to denounce the cities in which most of his miracles had taken place, because they didn’t repent.
speaker: Narrator

text: “How terrible it will be for you, Chorazin! How terrible it will be for you, Bethsaida! Because if the miracles that happened in you had taken place in Tyre and Sidon, they would have repented long ago in sackcloth and ashes.
speaker: Narrator

text: Indeed I tell you, it will be more bearable for Tyre and Sidon on Judgment Day than for you!
speaker: Narrator

text: “And you, Capernaum! You won’t be lifted up to heaven, will you? You’ll go down to Hell! Because if the miracles that happened in you had taken place in Sodom, it would have remained to this day.
speaker: Narrator

text: Indeed I tell you, it will be more bearable for the land of Sodom on Judgment Day than for you!”
speaker: Narrator

text: At that time Jesus said, “I praise you, Father, Lord of heaven and earth, because you have hidden these things from wise and intelligent people and have revealed them to infants.
speaker: Narrator

text: Yes, Father, because this is what was pleasing to you.
speaker: Narrator

text: All things have been entrusted to me by my Father. No one fully knows the Son except the Father, and no one fully knows the Father except the Son and the person to whom the Son chooses to reveal him.
speaker: Narrator

text: “Come to me, all of you who are weary and loaded down with burdens, and I will give you rest.
speaker: Narrator

text: Place my yoke on you and learn from me, because I am gentle and humble, and you will find rest for your souls,
speaker: Narrator

text: because my yoke is pleasant, and my burden is light.”
speaker: Narrator

text: At that time, Jesus walked through the grain fields on a Sabbath. His disciples became hungry and began picking heads of grain to eat.
speaker: Narrator

text: When the Pharisees saw this, they told him, “Look! Your disciples are doing what is not lawful to do on the Sabbath!”
speaker: Narrator

text: But he told them, “Haven’t you read what David did when he and his companions were hungry?
speaker: Narrator

text: How is it that he went into the house of God and ate the Bread of the Presence, which was not lawful for him and his companions to eat but was reserved for the priests?
speaker: Narrator

text: Or haven’t you read in the Law that on every Sabbath the priests in the Temple violate the Sabbath and yet are innocent?
speaker: Narrator

text: But I tell you, something greater than the Temple is here!
speaker: Narrator

text: If you had known what ‘I want mercy and not sacrifice’ means, you would not have condemned the innocent,
speaker: Narrator

text: for the Son of Man is Lord of the Sabbath.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Moving on from there, Jesus went into their synagogue.
speaker: Narrator

text: Suddenly, a man with a paralyzed hand appeared. The people asked Jesus if it was lawful to heal on Sabbath days, intending to accuse him of doing something wrong.
speaker: Narrator

text: But he asked them, “Is there a man among you who, if he had one sheep and it fell into a ditch on the Sabbath, wouldn’t take hold of it and pull it out?
speaker: Narrator

text: How much more is a human being worth than a sheep! So it is lawful to do good on Sabbath days.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then he told the man, “Hold out your hand.” He held it out and it became normal, as healthy as his other hand.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Pharisees, however, went out and plotted against Jesus to kill him.
speaker: Narrator

text: When Jesus became aware of this, he left that place. Many crowds followed him, and he healed all of them,
speaker: Narrator

text: ordering them not to make him known.
speaker: Narrator

text: This was to fulfill what was declared by the prophet Isaiah when he said,
speaker: Narrator

text:
“Here is my Servant whom I have chosen,
    whom I love, and with whom I am pleased!
I will put my Spirit on him,
    and he will proclaim justice to unbelievers.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He will not quarrel or shout,
    and no one will hear him shouting in the streets.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He will not snap off a broken reed
    or snuff out a smoldering wick
        until he has brought justice through to victory.
speaker: Narrator

text: And in his name unbelievers will hope.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then a demon-possessed man who was blind and unable to talk was brought to him. Jesus healed him so that the man could speak and see.
speaker: Narrator

text: All the crowds were amazed and kept saying, “This man isn’t the Son of David, is he?”
speaker: Narrator

text: But when the Pharisees heard this, they said, “This man drives out demons only by Beelzebul, the ruler of the demons.”
speaker: Narrator

text: He knew what they were thinking and told them, “Every kingdom divided against itself is destroyed, and every city or household divided against itself will not stand.
speaker: Narrator

text: So if Satan drives out Satan, he is divided against himself. How, then, can his kingdom stand?
speaker: Narrator

text: If I drive out demons by Beelzebul, by whom do your own followers drive them out? That is why they will be your judges!
speaker: Narrator

text: But if I drive out demons by the Spirit of God, then the kingdom of God has come to you.
speaker: Narrator

text: How can someone go into a strong man’s house and carry off his possessions without first tying up the strong man? Then he can ransack his house.
speaker: Narrator

text: The person who isn’t with me is against me, and the person who isn’t gathering with me is scattering.
speaker: Narrator

text: So I tell you, every sin and blasphemy will be forgiven, but blasphemy against the Spirit will not be forgiven.
speaker: Narrator

text: Whoever speaks a word against the Son of Man will be forgiven, but whoever speaks against the Holy Spirit will not be forgiven, either in this age or in the one to come.”
speaker: Narrator

text: “Either make the tree good and its fruit good, or make the tree rotten and its fruit rotten, because a tree is known by its fruit.
speaker: Narrator

text: You children of serpents! How can you say anything good when you are evil? The mouth speaks about what overflows from the heart.
speaker: Narrator

text: A good person brings good things out of a good treasure house, and an evil person brings evil things out of an evil treasure house.
speaker: Narrator

text: I tell you, on Judgment Day people will give an account for every thoughtless word they have uttered,
speaker: Narrator

text: because by your words you will be acquitted, and by your words you will be condemned.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then some of the scribes and Pharisees told Jesus, “Teacher, we want to see a sign from you.”
speaker: Narrator

text: But he replied to them, “An evil and adulterous generation craves a sign. Yet no sign will be given to it except the sign of the prophet Jonah,
speaker: Narrator

text: because just as Jonah was in the stomach of the sea creature for three days and three nights, so the Son of Man will be in the heart of the earth for three days and three nights.
speaker: Narrator

text: The men of Nineveh will stand up at the judgment and condemn the people living today, because they repented at the preaching of Jonah. But look—something greater than Jonah is here!
speaker: Narrator

text: The queen of the south will stand up and condemn the people living today, because she came from so far away to hear the wisdom of Solomon. But look! Something greater than Solomon is here!”
speaker: Narrator

text: “Whenever an unclean spirit goes out of a person, it wanders through waterless places looking for a place to rest, but finds none.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then it says, ‘I will go back to my home that I left.’ When it arrives, it finds it empty, swept clean, and put in order.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then it goes and brings with it seven other spirits more evil than itself, and they go in and settle there. And so the final condition of that person becomes worse than the first. That’s just what will happen to this evil generation!”
speaker: Narrator

text: While Jesus was still speaking to the crowds, his mother and brothers stood outside, wanting to speak to him.
speaker: Narrator

text: Someone told him, “Look! Your mother and your brothers are standing outside, asking to speak to you.”
speaker: Narrator

text: He asked the man who told him, “Who is my mother, and who are my brothers?”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then pointing with his hand at his disciples, he said, “Here are my mother and my brothers,
speaker: Narrator

text: because whoever does the will of my Father in heaven is my brother and sister and mother.”
speaker: Narrator

text: That day Jesus left the house and sat down beside the sea.
speaker: Narrator

text: Such large crowds gathered around him that he got into a boat and sat down, while the entire crowd stood on the shore.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then he began to tell them many things in parables. He said, “Listen! A farmer went out to sow.
speaker: Narrator

text: As he was sowing, some seeds fell along the path, and birds came and ate them up.
speaker: Narrator

text: Other seeds fell on stony ground, where they did not have a lot of soil. They sprouted at once because the soil wasn’t deep.
speaker: Narrator

text: But when the sun came up, they were scorched. Since they did not have any roots, they dried up.
speaker: Narrator

text: Other seeds fell among thorn bushes, and the thorn bushes grew higher and choked them out.
speaker: Narrator

text: But other seeds fell on good soil and produced a crop, some 100, some 60, and some 30 times what was sown.
speaker: Narrator

text: Let the person who has ears listen!”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the disciples came and asked Jesus, “Why do you speak to people in parables?”
speaker: Narrator

text: He answered them, “You have been given knowledge about the secrets of the kingdom from heaven, but it hasn’t been given to them,
speaker: Narrator

text: because to anyone who has something, more will be given, and he will have more than enough. But from the one who doesn’t have anything, even what he has will be taken away from him.
speaker: Narrator

text:
That’s why I speak to them in parables, because
‘they look but don’t see,
    and they listen but don’t hear or understand.’
speaker: Narrator

text:
“With them the prophecy of Isaiah is being fulfilled, which says:
‘You will listen and listen but never understand.
    You will look and look but never comprehend,
speaker: Narrator

text:
for this people’s heart has become dull,
    and their ears are hard of hearing.
They have shut their eyes
    so that they might not see with their eyes,
        and hear with their ears,
and understand with their heart and turn,
    and I would heal them.’
speaker: Narrator

text: “How blessed are your eyes because they see, and your ears because they hear!
speaker: Narrator

text: I tell all of you with certainty, many prophets and righteous people longed to see the things you see but did not see them, and to hear the things you hear but did not hear them.”
speaker: Narrator

text: “Listen, then, to the parable about the farmer.
speaker: Narrator

text: When anyone hears the word about the kingdom yet doesn’t understand it, the evil one comes and snatches away what was sown in his heart. This is what was sown along the path.
speaker: Narrator

text: As for what was sown on the stony ground, this is the person who hears the word and accepts it joyfully at once,
speaker: Narrator

text: but since he doesn’t have any root in himself, he lasts for only a short time. When trouble or persecution comes along because of the word, he immediately falls away.
speaker: Narrator

text: As for what was sown among the thorn bushes, this is the person who hears the word, but the worries of life and the deceitful pleasures of wealth choke the word so that it can’t produce a crop.
speaker: Narrator

text: But as for what was sown on good soil, this is the person who hears the word, understands it, and produces a crop that yields 100, 60, or 30 times what was sown.”
speaker: Narrator

text: He presented another parable to them: “The kingdom from heaven may be compared to a man who sowed good seed in his field.
speaker: Narrator

text: While people were sleeping, his enemy came and sowed weeds among the wheat and went away.
speaker: Narrator

text: When the crop came up and bore grain, the weeds appeared, too.
speaker: Narrator

text: “The owner’s servants came and asked him, ‘Master, you sowed good seed in your field, didn’t you? Then where did these weeds come from?’
speaker: Narrator

text:
“He told them, ‘An enemy did this!’
“The servants asked him, ‘Do you want us to go and pull them out?’
speaker: Narrator

text: “He said, ‘No! If you pull out the weeds, you might pull out the wheat with them.
speaker: Narrator

text: Let both grow together until the harvest, and at harvest time I will tell the reapers, “Gather the weeds first and tie them in bundles for burning, but bring the wheat into my barn.”’”
speaker: Narrator

text: He presented another parable to them, saying, “The kingdom from heaven is like a mustard seed that a man took and planted in his field.
speaker: Narrator

text: Although it is the smallest of all seeds, when it is fully grown it is larger than the garden plants and becomes a tree, and the birds in the sky come and nest in its branches.”
speaker: Narrator

text: He told them another parable: “The kingdom from heaven is like yeast that a woman took and mixed with three measures of flour until all of it was leavened.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus told the crowds all these things in parables. He did not tell them anything without using a parable.
speaker: Narrator

text:
This was to fulfill what was declared by the prophet when he said,
“I will open my mouth to speak in parables.
    I will declare what has been hidden
        since the creation of the world.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Jesus left the crowds and went into the house. His disciples came to him and asked, “Explain to us the parable about the weeds in the field.”
speaker: Narrator

text: He answered, “The person who sowed good seed is the Son of Man,
speaker: Narrator

text: while the field is the world. The good seed are those who belong to the kingdom, while the weeds are those who belong to the evil one.
speaker: Narrator

text: The enemy who sowed them is the Devil, the harvest is the end of the age, and the reapers are the angels.
speaker: Narrator

text: Just as weeds are gathered and burned with fire, so it will be at end of the age.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Son of Man will send his angels, and they will gather from his kingdom everything that causes others to sin and those who practice lawlessness
speaker: Narrator

text: and they will throw them into a blazing furnace. In that place there will be wailing and gnashing of teeth.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the righteous will shine like the sun in their Father’s kingdom. Let the person who has ears listen!”
speaker: Narrator

text: “The kingdom from heaven is like treasure hidden in a field that a man found and hid. In his excitement he went and sold everything he had and bought that field.”
speaker: Narrator

text: “Again, the kingdom from heaven is like a merchant searching for fine pearls.
speaker: Narrator

text: When he found a very valuable pearl, he went and sold everything he had and bought it.”
speaker: Narrator

text: “Again, the kingdom from heaven is like a large net thrown into the sea that gathered all kinds of fish.
speaker: Narrator

text: When it was full, the fishermen hauled it ashore. Then they sat down, sorted the good fish into containers, and threw the bad ones away.
speaker: Narrator

text: That is how it will be at the end of the age. The angels will go out, cull out the evil people from among the righteous ones,
speaker: Narrator

text: and will throw them into a blazing furnace. In that place there will be wailing and gnashing of teeth.”
speaker: Narrator

text:
“Do you understand all these things?”
They told him, “Yes.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then he told them, “That is why every scribe who has been trained for the kingdom from heaven is like the master of a household who brings both new and old things out of his treasure chest.”
speaker: Narrator

text: When Jesus had finished these parables, he left that place.
speaker: Narrator

text: He went to his hometown and began teaching the people in their synagogue in such a way that they were amazed and asked, “Where did this man get this wisdom and these miracles?
speaker: Narrator

text: This is the builder’s son, isn’t it? His mother is named Mary, isn’t she? His brothers are James, Joseph, Simon, and Judas, aren’t they?
speaker: Narrator

text: And his sisters are all with us, aren’t they? So where did this man get all these things?”
speaker: Narrator

text:
And they were offended by him.
But Jesus told them, “A prophet is without honor only in his hometown and in his own home.”
speaker: Narrator

text: He did not perform many miracles there because of their unbelief.
speaker: Narrator

text: At that time Herod the tetrarch, hearing about the fame of Jesus,
speaker: Narrator

text: told his servants, “This is John the Baptist! He has been raised from the dead, and that’s why these miracles are being done by him.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Herod had arrested John, bound him with chains, and put him in prison on account of Herodias, his brother Philip’s wife.
speaker: Narrator

text: John had been telling him, “It is not lawful for you to have her.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Although Herod wanted to kill him, he was afraid of the crowd, since they regarded John as a prophet.
speaker: Narrator

text: But when Herod’s birthday celebration was held, the daughter of Herodias danced before the guests. She pleased Herod
speaker: Narrator

text: so much that he promised with an oath to give her whatever she asked for.
speaker: Narrator

text: Prompted by her mother, she said, “Give me, right here on a platter, the head of John the Baptist.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Under pressure because of his promises and his assembled guests, the king ordered that it be done.
speaker: Narrator

text: So he sent word and had John beheaded in prison.
speaker: Narrator

text: His head was brought on a platter and given to the girl, and she took it to her mother.
speaker: Narrator

text: When John’s disciples came, they carried off the body and buried it. Then they went and told Jesus.
speaker: Narrator

text: When Jesus heard this, he left that place and went by boat to a deserted place by himself. The crowds heard of it and followed him on foot from the neighboring towns.
speaker: Narrator

text: When he got out of the boat, he saw a large crowd. He had compassion for them and healed their sick.
speaker: Narrator

text: When evening had come, the disciples went to him and said, “This is a deserted place, and it’s already late. Send the crowds away so that they can go into the villages and buy food for themselves.”
speaker: Narrator

text: But Jesus told them, “They don’t need to go away. You give them something to eat.”
speaker: Narrator

text: They told him, “We don’t have anything here except five loaves of bread and two fish.”
speaker: Narrator

text: He said, “Bring them to me.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then he ordered the crowds to sit down on the grass. Taking the five loaves and the two fish, he looked up to heaven and blessed them. Then he broke the loaves in pieces and gave them to his disciples, and the disciples gave them to the crowds.
speaker: Narrator

text: All of them ate and were filled. Then the disciples picked up what was left of the broken pieces, twelve baskets full.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now those who had eaten were about 5,000 men, besides women and children.
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus immediately had the disciples get into a boat and cross to the other side ahead of him, while he sent the crowds away.
speaker: Narrator

text: After dismissing the crowds, he went up on a hillside by himself to pray. When evening came, he was there alone.
speaker: Narrator

text: By this time the boat was in the middle of the sea and was being battered by the waves, because the wind was against them.
speaker: Narrator

text: Shortly before dawn, Jesus came to them, walking on the sea.
speaker: Narrator

text: When the disciples saw him walking on the sea, they were terrified and cried out, “It’s a ghost!” And they screamed in terror.
speaker: Narrator

text: “Have courage!” Jesus immediately told them. “It’s me. Stop being afraid!”
speaker: Narrator

text: Peter answered him, “Lord, if it’s you, order me to come to you on the water.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus said, “Come on!” So Peter got down out of the boat, started walking on the water, and came to Jesus.
speaker: Narrator

text: But when he noticed the strong wind, he was frightened. As he began to sink, he shouted, “Lord, save me!”
speaker: Narrator

text: At once Jesus reached out his hand, caught him, and asked him, “You who have so little faith, why did you doubt?”
speaker: Narrator

text: As they got into the boat, the wind stopped blowing.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the men in the boat began to worship Jesus, saying, “You certainly are the Son of God!”
speaker: Narrator

text: They crossed over and came ashore at Gennesaret.
speaker: Narrator

text: When the men of that place recognized Jesus, they sent word throughout that region and brought him everyone who was sick.
speaker: Narrator

text: They kept begging him to let them touch just the tassel of his garment, and everyone who touched it was completely healed.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then some Pharisees and scribes came from Jerusalem to Jesus and asked,
speaker: Narrator

text: “Why do your disciples disregard the tradition of the elders? They don’t wash their hands when they eat.”
speaker: Narrator

text: But he answered them, “Why do you also disregard the commandment of God because of your tradition?
speaker: Narrator

text: Because God said, ‘You are to honor your father and your mother,’ and, ‘Whoever curses father or mother must certainly be put to death.’
speaker: Narrator

text: But you say, ‘Whoever tells his father or his mother, “Whatever support you might have received from me has been given to God,”
speaker: Narrator

text: does not have to honor his father.’ Because of your tradition, then, you have disregarded the authority of God’s word.
speaker: Narrator

text: You hypocrites! How well did Isaiah prophesy of you when he said,
speaker: Narrator

text:
‘These people honor me with their lips,
    but their hearts are far from me.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Their worship of me is empty,
    because they teach human rules as doctrines.’”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then calling out to the crowd, he addressed them, “Listen and understand!
speaker: Narrator

text: It is not what goes into the mouth that makes a person unclean. It is what comes out of the mouth that makes a person unclean.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the disciples came and asked him, “Do you realize that the Pharisees were offended when they heard this statement?”
speaker: Narrator

text: He replied, “Every plant that my heavenly Father did not plant will be pulled up by the roots.
speaker: Narrator

text: Leave them alone. They are blind guides of the blind. If one blind person leads another blind person, both will fall into a ditch.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Peter told him, “Explain to us this parable.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus said, “Are you still so ignorant?
speaker: Narrator

text: Don’t you know that everything that goes into the mouth passes into the stomach and then is expelled as waste?
speaker: Narrator

text: But the things that come out of the mouth come from the heart, and it is those things that make a person unclean.
speaker: Narrator

text: It is out of the heart that evil thoughts come, as well as murder, adultery, sexual immorality, stealing, false testimony, and slander.
speaker: Narrator

text: These are the things that make a person unclean. But eating with unwashed hands doesn’t make a person unclean.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Jesus left that place and went to the region of Tyre and Sidon.
speaker: Narrator

text: Suddenly, a Canaanite woman from that territory came near and began to shout, “Have mercy on me, Lord, Son of David! My daughter is severely demon-possessed!”
speaker: Narrator

text:
But he didn’t answer her at all.
Then his disciples came up and kept urging him, “Send her away, because she keeps on screaming as she follows us.”
speaker: Narrator

text: But he replied, “I was sent only to the lost sheep of the nation of Israel.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then she came and fell down before him, saying, “Lord, help me!”
speaker: Narrator

text: He replied, “It’s not right to take the children’s bread and throw it to the puppies.”
speaker: Narrator

text: She said, “Yes, Lord. But even the puppies eat the crumbs that fall from their masters’ tables.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Jesus answered her, “Lady, your faith is great! What you want is granted.” That very hour her daughter was healed.
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus left there and went along the Sea of Galilee. Then he went up on a hillside and sat down.
speaker: Narrator

text: Large crowds came to him, bringing with them the lame, the blind, the crippled, those unable to talk, and many others. They placed them at his feet, and he healed them.
speaker: Narrator

text: As a result, the crowd was amazed to see those who were unable to talk speaking, the crippled healed, the lame walking, and the blind seeing. So they praised the God of Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Jesus called his disciples and said, “I have compassion for the crowd because they have already been with me for three days and have nothing to eat. I don’t want to send them away without food, or they may faint on the road.”
speaker: Narrator

text: The disciples asked him, “Where in the wilderness are we to get enough bread to feed such a crowd?”
speaker: Narrator

text:
Jesus asked them, “How many loaves of bread do you have?”
They said, “Seven, and a few small fish.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Ordering the crowd to sit down on the ground,
speaker: Narrator

text: he took the seven loaves and the fish and gave thanks. Then he broke them in pieces and kept giving them to his disciples, and the disciples gave them to the crowds.
speaker: Narrator

text: All of them ate until they were filled, then the disciples picked up what was left of the broken pieces—seven baskets full.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now those who had eaten were four thousand men, besides women and children.
speaker: Narrator

text: After he sent the crowds away, he got into a boat and went to the region of Magadan.
speaker: Narrator

text: When the Pharisees and Sadducees arrived, in order to test Jesus they asked him to show them a sign from heaven.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He replied to them, “You say,
‘Red sky at night,
    what a delight!
speaker: Narrator

text:
Red sky in the morning,
    cloudy and storming.’
You know how to interpret the appearance of the sky, yet you can’t interpret the signs of the times?
speaker: Narrator

text: An evil and adulterous generation craves a sign, but no sign will be given to it except the sign of Jonah.” Then he left them and went away.
speaker: Narrator

text: When his disciples reached the other side, they had forgotten to take any bread along.
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus told them, “Watch out! Beware of the yeast of the Pharisees and Sadducees!”
speaker: Narrator

text: As they began to discuss this among themselves, they kept saying, “We didn’t bring along any bread.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Knowing this, Jesus asked them, “You who have little faith, why are you discussing among yourselves the fact that you don’t have any bread?
speaker: Narrator

text: Don’t you understand yet? Don’t you remember the five loaves for the 5,000 and how many baskets you collected,
speaker: Narrator

text: or the seven loaves for the 4,000 and how many baskets you collected?
speaker: Narrator

text: How can you fail to understand that I wasn’t talking to you about bread? Beware of the yeast of the Pharisees and Sadducees!”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then they understood that he did not say to beware of the yeast used in bread, but of the teaching of the Pharisees and Sadducees.
speaker: Narrator

text: When Jesus had come to the region of Caesarea Philippi, he asked his disciples, “Who do people say the Son of Man is?”
speaker: Narrator

text: They said, “Some say John the Baptist, others Elijah, and still others Jeremiah or one of the prophets.”
speaker: Narrator

text: He asked them, “But who do you say I am?”
speaker: Narrator

text: Simon Peter answered, “You are the Messiah, the Son of the living God!”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Jesus told him, “How blessed you are, Simon son of Jonah, since flesh and blood has not revealed this to you, though my Father in heaven has.
speaker: Narrator

text: I tell you that you are Peter, and it is on this rock that I will build my congregation, and the powers of hell will not conquer it.
speaker: Narrator

text: I will give you the keys to the kingdom from heaven. Whatever you prohibit on earth will have been prohibited in heaven, and whatever you permit on earth will have been permitted in heaven.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then he strictly ordered the disciples not to tell anyone that he was the Messiah.
speaker: Narrator

text: From that time on, Jesus began to show his disciples that he would have to go to Jerusalem and suffer a great deal because of the elders, the high priests, and the scribes. Then he would be killed, but on the third day he would be raised.
speaker: Narrator

text: Peter took him aside and began to rebuke him, saying, “God be merciful to you, Lord! This must never happen to you!”
speaker: Narrator

text: But Jesus turned and told Peter, “Get behind me, Satan! You are an offense to me, because you are not thinking God’s thoughts but human thoughts!”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Jesus told his disciples, “If anyone wants to follow me, he must deny himself, pick up his cross, and follow me continuously.
speaker: Narrator

text: Whoever wants to save his life will lose it, but whoever loses his life for my sake will find it,
speaker: Narrator

text: because what profit will a person have if he gains the whole world and forfeits his life? Or what can a person give in exchange for his life?
speaker: Narrator

text: The Son of Man is going to come with his angels in his Father’s glory, and then he will repay everyone according to what he has done.
speaker: Narrator

text: I tell all of you with certainty, some people standing here will not experience death before they see the Son of Man coming in his kingdom.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Six days later, Jesus took Peter, James, and his brother John and led them up a high mountain by themselves.
speaker: Narrator

text: His appearance was changed in front of them, his face shone like the sun, and his clothes became as white as light.
speaker: Narrator

text: Suddenly, Moses and Elijah appeared to them, talking with Jesus.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Peter told Jesus, “Lord, it’s good that we’re here! If you want, I’ll set up three shelters—one for you, one for Moses, and one for Elijah.”
speaker: Narrator

text:
He was still speaking when a bright cloud suddenly overshadowed them.
A voice from the cloud said, “This is my Son, whom I love. I am pleased with him. Keep on listening to him!”
speaker: Narrator

text: When the disciples heard this, they fell on their faces and were terrified.
speaker: Narrator

text: But Jesus came up to them and touched them, saying, “Get up, and stop being afraid.”
speaker: Narrator

text: When they raised their eyes, they saw no one but Jesus all by himself.
speaker: Narrator

text: On their way down the mountain, Jesus ordered them, “Don’t tell anyone about this vision until the Son of Man has been raised from the dead.”
speaker: Narrator

text: So the disciples asked him, “Why, then, do the scribes say that Elijah must come first?”
speaker: Narrator

text: He answered them, “Elijah is indeed coming and will restore all things.
speaker: Narrator

text: But I tell you that Elijah has already come, yet people did not recognize him and treated him just as they pleased. In the same way, the Son of Man is going to suffer at their hands.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the disciples understood that he had been speaking to them about John the Baptist.
speaker: Narrator

text: As they approached the crowd, a man came up to Jesus, knelt down in front of him,
speaker: Narrator

text: and said, “Sir, have mercy on my son, because he is an epileptic and suffers terribly. Often he falls into fire and often into water.
speaker: Narrator

text: I brought him to your disciples, but they couldn’t heal him.”
speaker: Narrator
